intro: Godetia lassenensis, commonly known as the Lassen's godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
